title: Super easy to clean!
body: Long story short it was the first cup of the day and I miss placed the cup in my keurig and the entire 10oz k cup brewed itself into an open counter space. Without this mat I would‚Äôve had a HUGE MESS to clean. But the mat soaked it all up and dried super quick. That gave me enough time to wake up before I had to clean my mess. The quality is amazin and I really like the non slip design. The top is super soft and holds a lot of spills. It is also very durable because I was scrubbing it hard and wringing it out to clean the coffee out of it. I put it in a medium dryer with two big dry towels for about 20 minutes and it was dry enough for use again.

title: I like
body:
I've been using this single mat for one week now, and I must say, it has proven to be an excellent addition to my coffee setup. I've placed it under my coffee machine, and it's the perfect size to accommodate not only my coffee machine but also my tamping station and more. It's great that I made sure to get the right size for my needs.

The functionality of this mat is impressive. It's been particularly useful as a base for my espresso-making activities. Even coffee drips don't seem to pose a problem. I've found that wiping up spilled coffee with a sponge or cloth is easy and effective. And even on occasions when I've forgotten to clean up a coffee spill, the mat manages to make the evidence vanish.

Initially, I was disappointed because I thought I had ordered the black version of the mat, but it turned out that I received the dark gray one instead. While this was my mistake, it did leave me a bit underwhelmed. However, considering the hassle of returning, I've decided to stick with it.

Overall, I'm quite pleased with my purchase, and this mat has significantly contributed to a cleaner and more organized coffee space, explicitly tailored for my coffee-related needs.
author: Lo
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 9 de agosto de 2023

title: Basic but gets the job done
body: I grind my own coffee beans and was tired of the counters feeling gritty. I have a darker granite and it is sometimes hard to see crumbs/dirt. This mat fits perfectly under my coffee maker, grinder, and coffee bean jar. It is easy to wipe down, clean, and makes our coffee station look a lot more organized. It is nothing fancy, but would recommend.

title: The best dish mat I have owned
body: This is the blue 16" x 24" mat. It is perfect for my needs. I live in a tiny home and noticed my wooden butcher block counters being affected by the moisture of my dishes coming through other mats I have used/dish towels etc. I have a tiny coffee maker too so I am using it for both dishes and as a coffee mat. I really needed an ABSORBENT mat that was EASY to clean and that would not get moldy or funky. THIS IS IT folks. It does not show water rings (yay!!) and the water/moisture does not go through the mat!!! It is a very pleasant shade of blue as well. Once a month I let it dry outside in the sun. It may not be necessary to do this but I like the idea of drying it out, completely, every so often. HIGHLY recommend.

title: Good mat

Otherwise it's pretty good, even with the large size i could use a bit bigger, but it provides plenty of space for the coffee maker and a pouring area. Both the top and bottom have good grip, so it doesn't slide around and things on top of it don't slide around. It's not too cushiony that you have to worry about your mug tipping if it has a small base. Soaks up drops and spills and despite a solid gray color, doesn't show stains very prominently.

author: I purchased 3 of these items. All three came in as an unlabeled item and completely worthless due to improper packaging and what appears to be factory reject products being sold as new. The box's all had clear large Xs cut into them indication of rejects. Handles broken, literally the caps of hard plastic were broken or cracked. And 1 was not even in a box. I requested a return and refund. I now have confirmation they are refunding only 1 of these broken factory reject items. Not 3 but 1. The shipping label.reeads sender as Joe Doe of Jamica NY. This folks is a rip off and a scam. These mugs were meant to be Stanley mugs, we have real Stanly mugs and they are the same product ,just.not labeled. So someone has found a way to acquire Stanley mug rejects and resell.them unlabeled as top shelf. Do not but these pieces of garbage. For the record these were supposed to be gifts sent to my wife's mother . Junk.
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 10 de diciembre de 2023

title: This sucker sucks!!
body: This seemingly run of the mill mat resides in the most important part of the kitchen‚Äî the coffee machine counter. For countless mornings (because who‚Äôs counting?) this sucker has greedily sucked up water and coffee drips and drops, leaving no trace. I haven‚Äôt yet experienced the trauma of a full cup of coffee spilled on the mat to see if it would effectively suck that up as easily, thank heavens. Perhaps another brave review who is less dependent on coffee will test that for science. However, if you‚Äôre tired of wet counters from refilling and using the coffee machine, this sucker is worth it!!
author: Elizabeth Richard
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 2 de septiembre de 2022

title: Mat
body: It fit perfectly in my space - it‚Äôs easy to clean.
author: Amazon Fan
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 14 de diciembre de 2023

title: Works as advertised
body: Don‚Äôt do what we did - make sure the rubber side is DOWN and then the mat will lay flat. Absorbs or repels water, and thick enough to reduce some shaking from the espresso machine. We‚Äôll probably get another for under our dish rack!
author: Kayla
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 9 de agosto de 2023

title: worked great
body: took 2 small ones for my area, and they fit perfect, haven't used much besides placing them, but i'm happy with them

title: Exactly what I needed
body: I needed something absorbent to go under my coffee pot. The price was very reasonable. I like the product because it blends in well with my countertop. It looks durable. Only time will tell.
author: C. Friske

title: WOW!
body: I put this on the bottom of my Kurig/Nespresso machines and what a difference. No more coffee spots or stains. I cut it down and even used a piece on my fridge water dispenser and also no more water sitting. Would highly recommend.
author: Maria Gomez
